content: worry worm with a round head this is a pattern many experienced crocheters could come up with so i don t claim ownership this is just what i did for mine terminology pattern uses uk terminology for us terminology just substitute double_crochet for single_crochet magic_ring = magic_ring stitches used chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet = double_crochet substitute single_crochet or single_crochet for us terminology 2dc = increase decrease = decrease i use invisible decrease but you can use whichever decrease you prefer fo = fasten_off materials dk yarn in your chosen suitcase colour scraps of black dk for the eyes 3mm crochet hook or to size amigurumi should be tight and not allow stuffing to show needle for weaving ends in small amount of stuffing polyfil/yarn/whatever you prefer pattern row 1 - 6dc into magic_ring row 2 - 2dc into each st increase in each stitch 12st row 3 - 2dc double_crochet x6 18st row 4 to 6 - double_crochet in each 18 st row 7 - decrease double_crochet x6 12 st start stuffing here and each row until firmly stuffed row 8 - decrease x6 6 st at this point i do 1 additional decrease reducing the stitches and hole size 5st slip_stitch to next st now the body/spiral chain 30 in the 2nd st from the hook and each stitch following 4dc into each when you reach the other end where the hole is slip_stitch to the body and fasten_off leaving a small tail to weave through the stitches and close up the hole and weave in the end once you ve woven in the end trim off any excess yarn you can consider using any yarn scraps to stuff your next one eyes using black yarn do 2 stitches for each eye and make sure yarn ends are inside the head happy worm making by crafts on caffeine
